Obsidian.Elements Shared Facts about chemical Elements A Chemical element is a chemical substance that cannot be broken down into other substances.

Inorganic Chemistry deals with synthesis and behavior of inorganic and organometallic compounds. This field covers chemical compounds that are not carbon-based, which are the subjects of organic chemistry.
Organic chemistry is a subdiscipline within chemistry involving the scientific study of the structure, properties, and reactions of organic compounds and organic materials, i.

item.title: Actinide-Group
item.description: #chemic/Group The Actinide or actinoid series encompasses the 15 metallic chemical elements with atomic numbers from 89 to 103, actinium through lawrencium.

item.title: Actinium
item.description: [Name-en::Actinium] [Name-de::Actinium] [Weight-u::227] [AtomRadius::0] [Atom-Vol-ccm-mol::22.54] [Unknown2::0] [Radius-nm::5.17] [Electronegative::1.1] [Density::10.07] [MeltingPoint-C::1050] [BoilingPoint-C::3200] [HeatCapacity::0] [HeatConduct::0.12] [Enthalpy::0] [FormEnergy-kj-mol::0] (PeriodNo::7) (GroupNo::3) SpocWebEntityId: 21984 Actinium is a chemical element with the symbol (Abbr::Ac) and atomic number (Charge-e::89).

item.title: Caesium
item.description: #chemic/Element [GroupName:: Group-01-Alkali] [Name-en::Caesium] [Name-de::Caesium] [Weight-u::132.905] [AtomRadius::3.34] [Atom-Vol-ccm-mol::71.07] [Unknown2::2.35] [Radius-nm::3.894] [Density::1.87] [BoilingPoint-C::678.4] [HeatCapacity::0.24] [HeatConduct::0.359] [Enthalpy::2.092] [FormEnergy-kj-mol::67.74] (PeriodNo::6) (GroupNo::1) Caesium (IUPAC spelling) (or cesium in American English) is a chemical element with the symbol (Abbr::Cs) and atomic number (Charge-e::55).

item.title: Gallium
item.description: #chemic/Element [GroupName:: Group-13-Boron] [Name-en::Gallium] [Name-de::Gallium] [Weight-u::69.723] [AtomRadius::1.81] [Atom-Vol-ccm-mol::11.8] [Unknown2::1.26] [Radius-nm::5.999] [Electronegative::1.8] [Density::5.91] [MeltingPoint-C::29.78] [BoilingPoint-C::2403] [HeatCapacity::0.37] [HeatConduct::0.406] [Enthalpy::5.59] [FormEnergy-kj-mol::258.7] (PeriodNo::4) Gallium is a chemical element with the symbol (Abbr::Ga) and atomic number (Charge-e::31).

item.title: Group-01-Alkali
item.description: #chemic/Group Hydrogenium Lithium Sodium Potassium Rubidium Caesium Francium The alkali metals consist of the chemical elements lithium (Li), sodium (Na), potassium (K), rubidium (Rb), caesium (Cs), and francium (Fr).

item.title: Group-02-Earth-Alkaline
item.description: #chemic/Group Beryllium Magnesium Calcium Strontium Barium Radium The alkaline earth metals are six chemical elements in group 2 of the periodic table.

item.title: Group-03-Scandium
item.description: #chemic/Group Scandium Yttrium Lutetium Lawrencium Group 3 is the first group of transition metals in the periodic table.

item.title: Group-04-Titanium
item.description: #chemic/Group Titanium Zirconium Hafnium Rutherfordium Group 4 is the second group of transition metals in the periodic table.

item.title: Group-05-Vanadium
item.description: #chemic/Group Vanadium Niobium Tantalum Dubnium Group 5 is a group of elements in the periodic table.

item.title: Group-06-Chromium
item.description: #chemic/Group Chromium Molybdenum Tungsten Group 6, numbered by IUPAC style, is a group of elements in the periodic table.

item.title: Group-07-Manganese
item.description: #chemic/Group Manganese Technetium Rhenium Group 7, numbered by IUPAC nomenclature, is a group of elements in the periodic table.

item.title: Group-08-Iron
item.description: #chemic/Group Iron Osmium Ruthenium Group 8 is a group (column) of chemical elements in the periodic table.

item.title: Group-09-Cobalt
item.description: #chemic/Group Cobalt Iridium Rhodium Group 9, by modern IUPAC numbering, is a group (column) of chemical elements in the periodic table.

item.title: Group-10-Nickel
item.description: #chemic/Group Nickel Palladium Platinum Group 10, numbered by current IUPAC style, is the group of chemical elements in the periodic table that consists of nickel (Ni), palladium (Pd), platinum (Pt), and darmstadtium (Ds).

item.title: Group-11-Copper
item.description: #chemic/Group Copper Silver Gold Group 11, by modern IUPAC numbering, is a group of chemical elements in the periodic table, consisting of copper (Cu), silver (Ag), and gold (Au), and roentgenium (Rg), although no chemical experiments have yet been carried out to confirm that roentgenium behaves like the heavier homologue to gold.

item.title: Group-12-Zinc
item.description: #chemic/Group Zinc Cadmium Mercury Group 12, by modern IUPAC numbering, is a group of chemical elements in the periodic table.

item.title: Group-13-Boron
item.description: #chemic/Group Boron Aluminium Gallium Indium Thallium The boron group are the chemical elements in group 13 of the periodic table, comprising boron (B), aluminium (Al), gallium (Ga), indium (In), thallium (Tl), and nihonium (Nh).

item.title: Group-14-Carbon
item.description: #chemic/Group Carbon Silicon Germanium Tin Lead The carbon group is a periodic table group consisting of carbon (C), silicon (Si), germanium (Ge), tin (Sn), lead (Pb), and flerovium (Fl).

item.title: Group-15-Nitrogen
item.description: #chemic/Group Nitrogen Phosphorus Arsenic Antimony Bismuth A pnictogen ( or ; from Ancient Greek: πνῑ́γω “to choke” and -gen, “generator”) is any of the chemical elements in group 15 of the periodic table.

item.title: Group-16-Chalcogene
item.description: #chemic/Group Oxygen Sulfur Selenium Tellurium Polonium The chalcogens (ore forming) ( KAL-kə-jənz) are the chemical elements in group 16 of the periodic table.

item.title: Group-17-Halogene
item.description: #chemic/Group Fluorine Chlorine Bromine Iodine Astatine The halogens () are a group in the periodic table consisting of six chemically related elements: fluorine (F), chlorine (Cl), bromine (Br), iodine (I), astatine (At), and tennessine (Ts), though some authors would exclude tennessine as its chemistry is unknown and is theoretically expected to be more like that of gallium.

item.title: Group-18-Nobel-Gases
item.description: #chemic/Group Helium Neon Argon Krypton Xenon Radon The noble gases (historically also the inert gases; sometimes referred to as aerogens) make up a class of chemical elements with similar properties; under standard conditions, they are all odorless, colorless, monatomic gases with very low chemical reactivity.

item.title: Lanthanide-Group
item.description: #chemic/Group The Lanthanide or lanthanoid series of chemical elements comprises the 15 metallic chemical elements with atomic numbers 57–71, from lanthanum through lutetium.

item.title: Lanthanum
item.description: [Name-en::Lanthanum] [Name-de::Lanthan] [Weight-u::138.9055] [AtomRadius::2.74] [Atom-Vol-ccm-mol::20.73] [Unknown2::1.69] [Radius-nm::5.58] [Electronegative::1.1] [Density::6.7] [MeltingPoint-C::920] [BoilingPoint-C::3454] [HeatCapacity::0.19] [HeatConduct::0.135] [Enthalpy::6.2] [FormEnergy-kj-mol::414] (PeriodNo::6) (GroupNo::3) Lanthanum is a chemical element with the symbol (Abbr::La) and atomic number (Charge-e::57).

item.title: Silicon
item.description: #chemic/Element [GroupName:: Group-14-Carbon] [Name-en::Silicon] [Name-de::Silicium] [Weight-u::28.0855] [AtomRadius::1.46] [Atom-Vol-ccm-mol::12.1] [Unknown2::1.11] [Radius-nm::8.151] [Electronegative::1.9] [Density::2.33] [MeltingPoint-C::1410] [BoilingPoint-C::2355] [HeatCapacity::0.71] [HeatConduct::1.48] [Enthalpy::50.55] [FormEnergy-kj-mol::384.22] (PeriodNo::3) Silicon is a chemical element with the symbol (Abbr::Si) and atomic number (Charge-e::14).

item.title: Sodium
item.description: #chemic/Element [GroupName:: Group-01-Alkali] [Name-en::Sodium] [Name-de::Natrium] [Weight-u::22.9898] [AtomRadius::2.23] [Atom-Vol-ccm-mol::23.7] [Unknown2::1.54] [Radius-nm::5.139] [Electronegative::0.9] [Density::0.97] [MeltingPoint-C::97.81] [BoilingPoint-C::882.9] [HeatCapacity::1.23] [HeatConduct::1.41] [Enthalpy::2.598] [FormEnergy-kj-mol::96.96] (PeriodNo::3) Sodium is a chemical element with the symbol (Abbr::Na) (from Latin natrium) and atomic number (Charge-e::11).

item.title: Tungsten
item.description: #chemic/Element [GroupName:: Group-06-Chromium] [Name-en::Tungsten] [Name-de::Wolfram] [Weight-u::183.85] [AtomRadius::2.02] [Atom-Vol-ccm-mol::9.53] [Unknown2::1.3] [Radius-nm::7.98] [Electronegative::2.4] [HeatCapacity::0.13] [HeatConduct::1.74] [Enthalpy::35.4] [FormEnergy-kj-mol::824] (PeriodNo::6) SpocWebEntityId: 21970 Tungsten, or wolfram, is a chemical element with the symbol (Abbr::W) and atomic number (Charge-e::74).
